issue_title: [Security] Path traversal via path parameter - no validation against '../' sequences
summary: Fix path traversal vulnerability by validating paths for '../' sequences at TodoStorage construction time.
approach: Add _validate_path_safety() function that checks for '..' path components in both forward-slash and backslash variants. The validation happens at construction time to fail fast on malicious input.
risks: Users legitimately using '..' in paths (e.g., 'data/backup..json') will be blocked - this is considered acceptable as such patterns are unusual
Symlink-based traversal is not addressed by this fix - existing symlink protection in the codebase handles that
